user_auth.forms module

class user_auth.forms.ProfileForm(data=None, files=None, auto_id='id_%s', prefix=None, initial=None, error_class=<class 'django.forms.utils.ErrorList'>, label_suffix=None, empty_permitted=False, instance=None, use_required_attribute=None, renderer=None)[source]

Bases: ModelForm

A form for updating user profile information.

This form allows users to edit their profile information, including first name, last name, avatar, bio, date of birth, and email. It includes validation to ensure the email address is unique among users.

bio

A text field for the user’s bio.

Type:

CharField

Meta:

model (Profile): The model associated with the form. fields (list): The fields to include in the form.

Custom form validation to check the uniqueness of the email address.

base_fields = {'avatar': <django.forms.fields.ImageField object>, 'bio': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'date_of_birth': <django.forms.fields.DateField object>, 'email': <django.forms.fields.EmailField object>, 'first_name': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'last_name': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>}
clean()[source]

Custom form validation to check the uniqueness of the email address.

This method validates that the email address provided in the form is unique among users. It checks if the email is already in use by a different user.

Raises:

forms.ValidationError – If the email address is already in use.

declared_fields = {'bio': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>}
property media

Return all media required to render the widgets on this form.

class user_auth.forms.UserRegistrationForm(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: UserCreationForm

A form for user registration.

This form allows users to register with their first name and user credentials. It extends the built-in User model in Django.

first_name

A text field for the user’s first name.

Type:

CharField

property media

save(commit=True)[source]

Save the user registration information and create a new user instance.

This method is used to save the user’s registration information and create a new user instance. It sets the first name for the user based on the input in the form. By default, the method will save the user instance, but this can be controlled with the commit parameter.

Parameters:

commit (bool, optional) – If True, the user instance is saved to the database. If False, it is not saved (default is True).

Returns:

The user instance created or updated.

Return type:

User

user_auth.models module

class user_auth.models.Profile(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Model representing a user profile.

This model extends the built-in User model in Django to include additional user profile information, such as first name, last name, avatar, bio, date of birth, email, and new user status.

user

A one-to-one relationship to the User model, linking the profile to a specific user.

Type:

OneToOneField

first_name

The first name of the user (maximum length: 30 characters).

Type:

CharField

last_name

The last name of the user (maximum length: 30 characters).

Type:

CharField

avatar

An image representing the user’s avatar.

Type:

ImageField

bio

A text field for the user’s bio.

Type:

TextField

date_of_birth

The user’s date of birth.

Type:

DateField

email

The email address associated with the user.

Type:

EmailField

is_new

A boolean flag indicating if the user is new (default is True).

Type:

BooleanField

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

avatar

Just like the FileDescriptor, but for ImageFields. The only difference is assigning the width/height to the width_field/height_field, if appropriate.

bio

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

date_of_birth

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

email

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

first_name

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

id

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

is_new

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

last_name

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>
user

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')

Restaurant.place is a ForwardOneToOneDescriptor instance.

user_auth.views.authenticate_user(request)[source]

Authenticate user details.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The request object.

Returns:

Redirects to the login page on failure, or the user’s profile on success.

Return type:

HttpResponseRedirect
